page.title: 04Lighthorne Monastery
page.content:
The Lord of the Manor bequeathed some land(about 30 acres) to the monks of Sepulchres of Warwick.They worked this land until it was returned to the Lord of the Manor in 1546. The monks lived in what is now part of Church Farmhouse.The southern part of the house is the original building; the central and northern parts were added in the seventeenth century. The monks constructed a pond and put fish in it.Travellers would stop at the place as if it were an inn.It was called The Fish Stews.
Amanda Reilly Andrew Smillie Emma Butler
